#Text=Canada routs Sweden in sledge hockey at Winter Paralympics
#Text=Saturday , March 8 , 2014
#Text=Sweden 's starting goalie watches the third period from the bench Image : Laura Hale .
#Text=Earlier today , in the second game of sledge hockey play at the 2014 Winter Paralympics in Sochi , Russia , top-seeded Canada routed Sweden by a score of 10 – 1 .
#Text=Anthony Gale , Adam Dickson , and Dominic Larocque led their team in scoring with two goals a piece .
#Text=Canada dominated possession in the first period , and ended with four goals on eleven shots .
#Text=With the puck rarely in the Canadian third , Sweden managed only one shot on goal in the first .
#Text=Billy Bridges scored first for Canada , with Ben Delaney scoring Canada 's second , Adam Gale scoring Canada 's third and Dominic Larocque scoring Canada 's fourth goal in the first period .
#Text=Sweden came out with more energy in the second period , managing to get the puck more into the Canadian third of the rink but finished the period with only two shots on goal .
#Text=Canada on the other hand managed to get eleven shots on goal in the second period , scoring three times .
#Text=Kenth Jonsson came into goal to start the third period for Sweden , with Ulf Nilsson leaving .
#Text=The third period involved a lot of Canadian puck possession in the Swedish third .
#Text=When Sweden was able to make a run down the ice with the puck , the crowds cheered loudly .

#Text=Despite the puck possession issues , Sweden scored first in the third with a goal by Per Kasperi off an assist from Niklas Ingvarsson and Niklas Rakos with around 9:38 left in the third period .
#Text=Five minutes left , Canada went on to score a quick succession of goals , the first coming with 4:48 left in the third and during a power play .
#Text=Adam Dickson scored with an assist from Brad Bowden and Kevin Rempel .
#Text=Twenty seconds later , Dominic Larocque scored with an assist from Rempel .
#Text=With 3:30 left in the game , Canada went up 10 – 1 with a goal scored by Anthony Gale .
#Text=The Canadian fans were on their feet and waving their flags .
#Text=Neither team was able to score in the remaining time .
#Text=Canada had a much deeper bench than Sweden , and were able to execute multiple complete line changes .
#Text=In contest , Sweden had only three available players on their bench , with line changes consisting of changing only one player .
#Text=Canada 's official roster has 15 players and 2 goalkeepers , while Sweden 's has 12 and 2 goalkeepers .
#Text=Canada finished fourth at the 2010 Winter Paralympics , a contest played on home soil , with eight members of their current seventeen member roster returning to compete in the 2014 Games .
#Text=Despite the depth of experience for Canada , they were a younger squad than Sweden with an average age of 26 to Sweden 's 33 .
#Text=In sledge hockey , players use two hockey sticks , one in each hand .
#Text=One end of the hockey stick is very hard and used to propel the player down the ice .
#Text=The other side looks like a smaller version of a traditional ice hockey stick and is used to hit the puck .
#Text=Players compete while sitting in a sledge , which has two blades at the back that can be no longer than a third of the length of the sledge .
#Text=The height of the sledge off the ice is high enough that the puck may pass under it .
#Text=Image : Laura Hale .
